content.description: Sit start with a high left hand edge and a low right hand sidepull. From there, reach a right hand edge, bump it to a better edge, match next to it, bring the feet along, and continue up the slab using the edges to reach an easy mantel.
content.protection: A pad will work. The landing is great.
content.location: It climbs the south face of due West.

climbs.name: No Name Will Ever Exist For Anything aka Trailer Trash

content.description: This is a powerful compression problem on the backside of the Due West Boulder. Squat start with your left hand on an okay sidepull and a slopey pinch for your right hand. Make two hard bumps with your right hand, and gain the juggy lip however you can.
content.location: If you go through the little slot next to the V4, this problem is on the southwest side of the boulder.

climbs.name: No Boulder Shall Ever Be Onsighted

content.description:
This starts to the right of "

No Name...

". Sit start matching an obvious left-facing feature. Go up and right. Make a big move or do a really hard gaston into the left-facing feature to the right. This feels harder than "

No Name...

". It has cool sculpted crimps.
content.location:
It is rIght of "

No Name...

".

content.description:
Carried On The Wind climbs an undercut slab that requires an attentive start. Once the initial move goes, the problem goes quite smoothly.

Sit start with hands matched on the vertical rail and feet pasted to the left. From there, stick the edge above, reel in the feet, match on the edge, move up to the edges above, place a right heel on an edge, pull up to the great rail on the slab, and top out the problem.
content.protection: A pad or two. The landing has a rock behind it, but it wasn't an issue. There is a great landing.
content.location: It climbs the south face of Due West.
